title: Sport (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Parking in
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Parking in 

Disabled Person’s Parking Bay) Regulations 2022. 

(2) The Road Traffic (Traffic and Parking) Regulations 1997 to 2019 and 
these Regulations may be cited together as the Road Traffic (Traffic and 
Parking) Regulations 1997 to 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited road traffic (parking disabled person parking bay) regulation 2022 (2) road traffic (traffic parking) regulation 1997 2019 regulation may cited together road traffic (traffic parking) regulation 1997 2022

title: Sport (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

 In these Regulations— 

“disabled person’s parking bay” has the meaning assigned to it in article 19 of 
the Road Traffic (Signs) Regulations 1997 (S. I. No. 181 of 1997); 

“disabled person’s parking permit” means a disabled person’s parking permit 
(within the meaning of article 43 (inserted by the Road Traffic (Traffic and 
Parking) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 (S. I. No. 239 of 2011)) of the Road 
Traffic (Traffic and Parking) Regulations 1997 (S. I. No. 182 of 1997)).
text_norm: 2 regulations-- disabled person parking bay meaning assigned article 19 road traffic (signs) regulation 1997 (s i no 181 1997) disabled person parking permit mean disabled person parking permit (within meaning article 43 (inserted road traffic (traffic parking) (amendment) regulation 2011 (s i no 239 2011)) road traffic (traffic parking) regulation 1997 (s i no 182 1997))

title: Sport (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.
heading: 3. A person who is not the holder of a disabled person’s parking permit
text_raw:
3. A person who is not the holder of a disabled person’s parking permit 
shall not park a vehicle, in which is displayed a disabled person’s parking 
permit, in a disabled person’s parking bay unless it is parked for the 
convenience of the person to whom the permit was granted. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 31 August 2022 

HILDEGARDE NAUGHTON, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [427] 3

title: Sport (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations make it an offence to park in a disabled person’s parking 
bay other than for the convenience of the permit holder. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [427]
